malp.DemonSkies

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • malp.DemonSkies.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameEngine represents the current game state, including the Player entity, enemy entities, and statistics such as the score, highScore, and souls. It also includes helper methods to update the game state and render it onto a window.

      The arrow entity.
      private int continuumLevel
      The player's continuum upgrade level.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Entity> deferredEntities
      The deferred entities, to be added in the next update loop.
      private int deltaSum
      The accumulated differences in milliseconds between game state updates.

      The discarded entities, to be removed at the start of the next update loop.

      The player's haste upgrade level.

      The high score.

      The only instance of the GameEngine(), used to reinforce the singleton design pattern.

      The live entities within the game engine.

      The Constant MAX_UPGRADE_LEVEL represents the highest tier of upgrade possible.

      The update count tracks the number of times update(GameContainer, int) has been called this round.
      private static int UPGRADE_PRICE
      The Constant UPGRADE_PRICE represents the price an upgrade tier should cost.

      The player's velocity upgrade level.

                      int delta)
        Updates the game state and returns whether or not the game is still running or over.
        Parameters:
        gc - The GameContainer
        delta - The difference in milliseconds since the last update
        Returns:
        true, if the player is still alive
